summary:
GameStop's Bunny $BUCK - GameStop unveiled Buck as their official mascot during the 2009 GameStop conference. Since then, he has featured prominently in numerous commercials and has become a symbol of the GameStop brand. Even today, Buck continues to appear in advertisements and reward marketing campaigns, including those in Australia, where loyal customers earn "carrots" for dollars spent through Buck. At one point, Buck enjoyed widespread popularity, surpassing even Mario, particularly when the hit title "Bunny's Big Adventure" was released in 1981.

  -
